author: sky.cactus
content: Is anyone opposed to removing the `created` field from EIP metadata?

author: sky.cactus
content: It is redundant with git history.

author: abcoathup
content:
Is there a good way to work out when EIPs get merged for the first time as draft EIPs?  
Currently most EIPs get manually included in Week in Ethereum News when the PR is created (unless it is a draft PR)

author: sky.cactus
content: Do you mean merged as drafts?

author: gcolvin
content: It is helpful in seeing at a glance just how very old some EIPs are ðŸ˜‰

author: sky.cactus
content: The number gives you a relative sense of age.

author: sky.cactus
content: How old a standard is shouldn't matter much though.  The TCP standard is still super useful today, even though it is much older than some newer standards (for example).

author: wschwab
content:
Would an EIP around JSON metadata for NFTs be an ERC or Informational in your opinions?
On the one hand, it sounds ERC-like, and both EIP-721 and EIP-1155 have sections for JSON metadata, but on the other the JSON metadata itself is not (generally) stored on-chain, so that made me think maybe it's informational just by virtue of not really pertaining to a contract standard or anything else strictly on-chain.

author: sky.cactus
content: I hate informational.  So my vote is ERC.
